marketNews.title: IHSG down -0.70%, Prajogo Pangestu Buys 30.9 Million BRPT Shares
marketNews.content: Compendium of news for today. February 5, 2025.

marketNews.title: BMRI FY24: Net Profit +1.3% YoY, Loans +19.5% YoY
marketNews.content: Bank Mandiri recorded net profit of 13.8 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (-14% YoY, -11% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for FY24 to reach 55.8 trillion rupiah (+1.3% YoY), in line with expectations as it equals 99% of the consensus FY24F estimate. This performance was supported by: 1) Net Interest Margin (NIM) in line with guidance; 2) Cost of Credit (CoC) reaching an all-time low level; 3) solid loan growth; and 4) swelling operational expenses.

marketNews.title: NIM In Line with Guidance; FY25 NIM Target at 5-5.2%
marketNews.content: Bank-only NIM - which was a concern in 3Q24 - improved in 4Q24 to 4.95% (vs. 3Q24: 4.86%, 4Q23: 4.96%). This result brought the consolidated NIM for FY24 to 5.15% (vs. FY23: 5.48%), in line with management's FY24 guidance in the range of 5-5.3%. Loan yield increased due to repricing in several credit segments and is expected to remain high at least until 1H25. On the other hand, NIM was suppressed by an increasing Cost of Fund (CoF), mainly from the increase in CoF on Time Deposits (TD). BMRI management targets NIM for FY25 in the range of 5-5.2%, tending to be stable compared to FY24 realization and guidance.

marketNews.title: CoC Reaches All-Time Low Level; FY25 CoC Target at 1-1.2%
marketNews.content: BMRI recorded a CoC of 0.79% during FY24 (vs. FY23: 0.85%), better than management's FY24 guidance of <=1% while marking the lowest annual CoC in the company's history. This result was supported by maintained asset quality, with Gross Non Performing Loan (NPL) improving to 1.12% (vs. 4Q23: 1.19%, 3Q24: 1.13%), while Loan-at-Risk (LAR) managed to be recorded below pre-pandemic levels at 6.76% (vs. 4Q23: 8.62%, 3Q24: 7.51%). BMRI management targets CoC to normalize in the range of 1-1.2% during FY25.

marketNews.title: Solid Loan Growth; Loan Growth Targets Slow Down in FY25
marketNews.content: BMRI recorded loan growth of +19.5% YoY in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23: +16.3% YoY, 3Q24: +20.8% YoY), exceeding management's FY24 guidance in the range of +16-18% YoY. Loan growth was supported by the wholesale segment (+26% YoY), mainly driven by the corporate segment. Meanwhile, third-party funds (DPK) only grew by +7.7% YoY, resulting in a consolidated Loan-to-Deposit Ratio (LDR) reaching 90% in 4Q24. BMRI targets LDR to normalize and decrease to the range of 90-95% during FY25, with loan growth slowing down to the range of +10-12% YoY.

marketNews.title: Operational Expenses Swell
marketNews.content: BMRI's net profit performance in 4Q24 was more pressured by swelling operational expenses. Operationally, Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPOP) decreased to 21.1 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (-6.8% YoY, -9.5% QoQ) following swelling operational expenses (+23% YoY, +36% QoQ). This occurred as general and administrative expenses rose significantly in 4Q24 (+41% YoY, +63% QoQ) and during FY24 rose +17% YoY.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: We assess BMRI's performance as neutral. We see the NIM performance in line with FY24 guidance as a positive aspect of BMRI's performance in 4Q24, considering NIM was a concern in 9M24 performance. Going forward, the main challenge in FY25 is focused on liquidity aspects, which may affect CoF and NIM. This is mainly considering the company's LDR is already at a quite high level. For additional information, BMRI management plans to maintain the dividend payout ratio (DPR) for the 2024 fiscal year at >=60% (vs. 2023: 60%), indicating a dividend yield of approximately 6.5% based on stock price as of Wednesday (5/2) at 5,525 rupiah per share. *This article was previously released on Wednesday (5/2) afternoon in Stockbit Commentary.

marketNews.title: BPS records that Indonesia's economic growth reached +5.02% YoY in 4Q24
marketNews.content: BPS recorded that Indonesia's economic growth reached +5.02% YoY in 4Q24 (vs. 3Q24: +4.95% YoY), exceeding consensus expectations at the level of +4.98% YoY. Quarterly, Indonesia's economic growth grew +0.53% QoQ in 4Q24 (vs. 3Q24: +1.5% QoQ), lower than consensus expectations at the level of +0.56% QoQ. This result made Indonesia's economic growth throughout 2024 only reach +5.03% YoY (vs. 2023: +5.05% YoY), lower than the government target of +5.2% YoY and marking the lowest growth in the last 3 years. Indonesia's economic growth throughout 2024 was driven by household consumption (+4.94% YoY) and gross fixed capital formation (+4.61% YoY), with contributions reaching +2.6 percentage points and +1.43 percentage points, respectively. Meanwhile, net exports recorded a negative contribution of -0.01 percentage point due to imports rising (+7.95% YoY) higher than export growth (+6.51% YoY). Government consumption (+6.61% YoY) contributed +0.48 percentage points, with the remaining +0.53 percentage points coming from other variables.

marketNews.title: US President Donald Trump Proposed the Takeover of Gaza by the US
marketNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, on Tuesday (4/2) proposed the takeover of Gaza by the US, although he did not elaborate further. Trump's statement was delivered during a joint press conference with Israeli Prime Minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, who was visiting. Previously, Trump also suggested that Palestinians should be permanently relocated from Gaza.

marketNews.title: Government Postpones Distribution of 10kg Rice Aid
marketNews.content: Coordinating Minister for Food Affairs, Zulkifli Hasan, said on Tuesday (4/2) that the government postponed the distribution of food aid in the form of 10 kg of rice per month, which was originally scheduled to occur in January-February 2025. Zulkifli mentioned that the distribution of this aid was postponed to maintain rice prices at the farmer level, considering that the peak harvest season has now begun. Zulkifli said the food aid would still be distributed after the peak harvest season is over, although he did not specify further.

marketNews.title: US Labor Statistics Bureau Recorded a Drop in Job Vacancies
marketNews.content: The US labor statistics bureau recorded that job vacancies in the US dropped by 556,000 to 7.6 million in December 2024 (vs. November 2024: 8.16 million), lower than consensus expectations at the level of 8 million and marking the lowest level in the last 3 months. This result indicates that the US labor market is gradually weakening.

tickerNews.title: Prajogo Pangestu Buys 30.9 Million BRPT Shares
tickerNews.content: BRPT: Barito Pacific's controller and President Commissioner, Prajogo Pangestu, bought 30.9 million BRPT shares at an average price of 923.77 rupiah per share on January 30, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 28.5 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Prajogo Pangestu's ownership in BRPT increased from 71.31% to 71.35%.

tickerNews.title: XL Axiata Recorded Net Profit of 502 Billion Rupiah in 4Q24
tickerNews.content: EXCL: XL Axiata recorded a net profit of 502 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (+95% YoY, +72% QoQ). This result made the net profit for FY24 reach 1.8 trillion rupiah (+45% YoY), in line with expectations as it equals 99% of the consensus FY24F estimate. Operationally, operating profit in 4Q24 reached 1.5 trillion rupiah (+33% YoY, +20% QoQ), so operating profit during FY24 reached 5.6 trillion rupiah (+28% YoY) and slightly above expectations as it equals 103% of the consensus FY24F estimate. The average revenue per user (ARPU) for the mobile segment in 4Q24 remained stable at 41 thousand rupiah (-5% YoY, +0% QoQ), with the number of customers rising to 58.8 million (+2% YoY, +0.3% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: Kalbe Farma Recorded Indicated Net Profit of 861 Billion Rupiah in 4Q24
tickerNews.content: KLBF: Kalbe Farma recorded an indication of net profit of 861 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (+23% YoY, +50% QoQ). This result made the indication of net profit during FY24 reach 3.24 trillion rupiah (+17.1% YoY), in line with expectations as it equals 102% of the consensus FY24F estimate. The good net profit performance in 4Q24 was contributed by 2 main factors, namely: 1) revenue growing +7% YoY and +6% QoQ; and 2) gross profit margin increasing to 41.3% (vs. 4Q23: 37%, 3Q24: 38.6%). KLBF itself targets revenue and net profit to grow by +8-10% YoY in 2025 respectively.

tickerNews.title: GoTo Clarifies No Merger Agreement with Any Party
tickerNews.content: GOTO: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia stated in a clarification to the IDX that there is no agreement between the company and any party to conduct a merger transaction, as reported by mass media. GOTO also mentioned that no discussions were held by the company regarding any agreement with Grab Holdings Ltd. (Nasdaq: GRAB). GOTO's clarification came after DealStreetAsia reported that GOTO and Grab were accelerating merger talks and aiming for an agreement to be reached in 2025. Following the DealStreetAsia report, Bloomberg reported that Grab is considering acquiring GOTO at a valuation of over 7 billion US dollars, where one of the scenarios being discussed is the purchase of all GOTO shares at more than 100 rupiah per share.

tickerNews.title: Bank Negara Indonesia Plans Share Buyback with Fund Allocation Up to 905 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: BBNI: Bank Negara Indonesia plans to hold a share buyback with a fund allocation of up to 905 billion rupiah. The share buyback is expected to take place for a maximum of 12 months since its approval at the GMS on March 13, 2025. The share buyback will be carried out at a price considered reasonable by the company, taking into account POJK No. 29/2023. Treasury shares from the buyback are intended for the employee and/or director and board of commissioner stock ownership program.

tickerNews.title: Trans Power Marine Targets 15-20% Performance Growth in 2025
tickerNews.content: TPMA: Trans Power Marine Director, Rudy Sutiono, said that his party targets performance growth of around +15-20% in 2025. TPMA itself allocated a capex of 14 million US dollars during 2025 (vs. 2024 capex allocation: 20 million US dollars), which is intended for the addition of 4 sets of tugboats and barges.

tickerNews.title: Indomobil Sukses Internasional Completes Distribution Partnership for Yadea Electric Motorcycles
tickerNews.content: IMAS: Indomobil Sukses Internasional announced that it has completed the distribution partnership for the Yadea brand electric motorcycle along with its derivative products. Subsequently, Yadea will directly manage its business in Indonesia. In a separate information disclosure, IMAS together with its subsidiary, PT IMG Sejahtera Langgeng, established a new company named PT Indo Zeeda Energi with a total paid-up capital of 5 billion rupiah. This company will carry out business activities supporting electricity, manufacturing of motor vehicle spare parts and accessories, and self-owned or leased real estate.

tickerNews.title: Soechi Lines President Director Sold 120 Million SOCI Shares
tickerNews.content: SOCI: Soechi Lines President and Director, Go Darmadi, sold 120 million SOCI shares at an average price of 160 rupiah per share on January 24, 2025. The total transaction value reached 19.2 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Go Darmadi's ownership in SOCI decreased from 1.7% to zero.

tickerNews.title: Hapsoro, Controller of Sanurhasta Mitra ($MINA), Sold Shares
tickerNews.content: The controller of Sanurhasta Mitra (MINA), Hapsoro, sold 46.8 million MINA shares at an average price of 82 rupiah per share between January 24 and February 4, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 3.8 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Hapsoro's direct ownership in MINA decreased from 5.73% to approximately 5.02%.

tickerNews.title: Pemberton Asian Opportunities Fund Bought Shares in Sarimelati Kencana ($PZZA)
tickerNews.content: A shareholder of Sarimelati Kencana (PZZA), Pemberton Asian Opportunities Fund, bought approximately 11 million PZZA shares at an average price of approximately 159.9 rupiah per share on February 4, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 1.8 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Pemberton Asian Opportunities Fund's ownership in PZZA increased from 8.97% to 9.34%.

tickerNews.title: Budi Gunawan, Controller and President Director of Guna Timur Raya ($TRUK), Bought Shares
tickerNews.content: The controller and President Director of Guna Timur Raya (TRUK), Budi Gunawan, bought 5 million TRUK shares at an average price of 103 rupiah per share on February 3, 2025. The total transaction value reached 515 million rupiah. Following this transaction, Budi Gunawan's ownership in TRUK increased from 1.23% to 2.38%.
